header_summary:
Greg Maxwell highlighted an established practice within the Bitcoin Core network, where provably unspendable outputs are excluded from storage, emphasizing its role as an implementation detail rather than a consensus change. This approach, which includes ignoring outputs over 10kb and those beginning with OP_RETURN, is aimed at enhancing blockchain efficiency without affecting interoperability or consensus mechanisms among developers on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List. [More details](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAAS2fgTjF_e5vLEzp672_jmF82jDUre0wcZKHB5my8kTdFOGgw@mail.gmail.com/T/#m8e8f3f7141da1809fe8480f47fce0b97bf7d95f0)

Murch's contribution discusses the management of "dust-class" Unspent Transaction Outputs (UTXOs) on the Bitcoin network, proposing a segregation of these UTXOs into a separate sub-mempool to improve bandwidth usage. This proposal aims to balance network resources and accommodate low-value transactions efficiently, though there's skepticism about its practicality and impact on miner behavior and transaction fee savings. [Learn more](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/02d7368e-95d3-4185-b70f-3aa9b5df1e1d@murch.one/T/#m476d073294a90615e43218e5426cf45334b55cb1)

Ethan Heilman discusses the potential for seamless transitions in blockchain hashing algorithms through soft forking, using the shift from SHA256 to MD6 as an example. This method would allow for the integration of technological advancements without major network disruptions, highlighting the adaptability and forward-thinking within the Bitcoin ecosystem. [Read further](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAEM=y+W8c=CocE-T-uKRmLPH6fzL_dr38iW2VU-3Z9OaWA9Z5A@mail.gmail.com/T/#meb6317bc3fa2d5b3bc3d8fddf1361d99faa292e4)

Lastly, discussions around post-quantum cryptography (PQC) and the enhancement of blockchain transactions with Zero-Knowledge (ZK) proofs by authors like moonsettler and halseth respectively, underscore the ongoing efforts to fortify cryptographic practices against emerging threats and improve transactional flexibility and security. These conversations reflect a broader commitment within the blockchain community to continually evolve and strengthen the technology against both current and future challenges. [PQC insights](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/shrincs-324-byte-stateful-post-quantum-signatures-with-static-backups/2158/2) and [ZK proofs exploration](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/building-a-vault-using-blinded-co-signers/2141/3)

active_posts.title: Dust Expiry: Clean the UTXO set from spam
active_posts.summary:

- The solution would make small, old outputs unspendable, allowing for UTXO set cleanup.
